prompts.prompt: If I were to try to speed run Elden Ring with a fresh character, what is the quickest boss sequence to tackle in order to rush through to the Elden Beast?

outputs:
In Elden Ring, there are several ways to approach the game depending on playstyle preferences. For those interested in speedrunning, here's one recommended boss sequence for quickly progressing towards the final battle against the Elden Beast:

1. Start from the Prologue area and clear the first few main story missions until reaching Stormveil Castle. This will allow players to obtain the necessary items and spells required for later battles.
2. After entering Stormveil Castle, head straight to the second floor where the First Church of Marika is located. Defeat Malenia Blade of Miquella boss within this location.
3. After defeating Malenia, return to the overworld and travel to Leyndell Royal Capital. Enter the Academy Gatehouse and defeat Radagon Fiaceit's Glintstone Dragon boss.
4. From the Academy Gatehouse, go northwest to Raya Lucaria Academy and complete the questline leading up to fighting Godrick the Grafted. Defeat him to acquire his Greatshield and proceed to the Divine Tower of Liurnia.
5. Climb the tower and reach the top, where the Golden Seal can be found. Use it to access the Lands Between outside the tower. Then, head southwest to find the Red Wolf of Radagon boss near the Crumbling Farum Azula ruins. Defeat it to receive its scarlet armament and continue westward along the coast.
6. At the Consecrated Snowfield region, find the Mausoleum site of Queen Marika statue and explore its surroundings. Here, encounter an optional but powerful mini-boss called The Erdtree Burrower before moving forward.
7. Finally, journey southeast across the vast plains leading into Nokron, Eternal City. Inside the city, confront the bosses guarding each of the four portals - Mohgwyn Palace's Flame Tank Knights, Audience Chamber's Magma Wyrm, Sanguine Demi-Human Shardbearers, and Carian Piercer. Each of these fights requires careful planning but offers great rewards upon victory.

Note that this suggested route focuses primarily on acquiring key items and facing major challenges while skipping many side quests and exploration elements commonly associated with traditional playthroughs. To experience more of Elden Ring's rich worldbuilding, consider taking detours or completing additional tasks alongside the main story progression.</s>

To quickly get from the starting area (Golden Order Gardens) to the Elden Beast, it would be best to do the following:
1. From Golden Order Gardens, take the left path out of the area, go past the first Site of Grace until you reach the second one named Rykard’s Royal Academy.
2. Activate the grace at this site, then head back down towards the main road where you found the second Site of Grace. Turn right here and follow the road around the lake on your way to Nokstella, Eternal City. The first major boss along this route is Rykard, Lord of Blades.
3. After defeating Rykard, continue straight ahead until you encounter Godrick the Grafted, which will likely be your next major fight. Defeat him and move forward to find Radahn, the Fiery Knight.
4. After defeating Radahn, return to the Main Road South from where you fought Radahn and turn left onto the smaller dirt road just before reaching the Carian Slicers Site of Grace. Follow this small road all the way up until you meet Morgott, the Omen King.
5. Finally after defeating Morgott, head northwest towards the Lake-Facing Cliffs Site of Grace. Along the way, you may come across some enemies such as Malenia Blade of Miquela. Once you have reached the Lake-Facing Cliffs, proceed into the next room and take the lift down to the lowest level, where you will face Mohg, Lord of Blood.
6. After defeating Mohg, follow the path forward and climb up the stairs to the right, continuing westwards until you reach the Grand Lift of Dectus Site of Grace. Here you can activate the grace and teleport to the Elden Throne Room. Head straight for the elevator on the far side of the room and ride it up to face the final boss: Elden Beast.

This entire process takes about 20 minutes if done efficiently without dying much, including all cutscenes and travel time between sites of grace. It assumes you have minimal equipment and haven't spent too much time exploring previous areas. However, keep in mind that each player has different play styles so this might vary depending on individual choices during gameplay.</s>

The fastest way to clear all the bosses up until the final boss, Malenia, and get to the Elden Beast quickly would be:
1. Murdelain (Warrior) - 3rd boss on the left from the entrance of Leyndell Royal Capital
2. Rykard, Lord of Blades - 4th boss past Mordelain
3. Godrick the Grafted - 5th boss from the entrance
4. Radahn - 6th boss past Godrick
5. Malakya the Warrior - 7th boss past Radahn
6. Mohgwyn Palace (Queens Gate) - 8th boss past Malakya
7. Marika's Reborn Dolls - 9th boss past Mohgwyn Palace
8. Sword Saint Night's Cavalry - 10th boss past the Dolls
9. Starscourge Radahn - 11th boss past the Cavalry
10. Red Wolf of Radagon - 12th boss past Starscourge Radahn
11. Godfrey Firstborn - 13th boss past the Red Wolf
12. Tarnished Wolves of Radagon - Final Boss before getting to the Elden Beast.
Note: These steps assume you have defeated all the optional Golden Seals bosses prior to this point for additional rewards.</s>

To speedrun Elden Ring efficiently, it's important to choose an appropriate starting class and focus on acquiring powerful gear early on.

One viable approach for quickly progressing through the game and defeating the Elden Beast involves clearing certain areas and bosses in a specific order:

1. Starting from Leyndell Royal Capital, head southwest towards Caelid and defeat Radahn at Carian Slicer before moving on to Necroholic's Ambition.
2. Travel back to Leyndell and take the elevator down to the Underground Waterway, where you can find Death Rite Bird's Lair and Margit, the Fell Omen. Defeat both bosses consecutively without returning to the surface.
3. Return to Leyndell again and enter the Grand Lift of Dectus, which leads to the Morgue. In this area, you must first defeat The Shattered Man and then continue until you reach the bottom level, where you will encounter God-Knight Garr. After his death, use the lift to access the Demi-Human Queen's Garden and battle Malenia, Blade of Miquella last.
4. Once all four bosses have been defeated, return to Leyndell and speak with Melina to access the Academy Glintstone Crystal. From here, follow the path leading southeast towards Mount Gelmir, where you'll encounter the Elden Beast. With proper preparation and skill, it's possible to defeat this final boss and complete the game in record time. Remember to equip powerful weapons, armor, and spells, and prioritize efficiency in combat by using fast-paced playstyle and avoiding unnecessary encounters along the way. It might require multiple attempts and some trial and error, but following this sequence of boss battles can significantly shorten your journey through Elden Ring and lead you closer to victory against the mighty Elden Beast. Good luck on your quest!</s>

The quickest boss sequence to tackle when trying to speedrun Elden Ring with a fresh character would likely be:

1. Margit the Fell Omen - This boss can be defeated relatively quickly by using a combination of melee attacks and spells.
2. Godrick the Grafted - This boss has multiple phases, but each phase can be defeated fairly quickly if you use the right strategy. For example, you can use a spell to stun him during his first phase, then attack him with melee weapons during his second phase.
3. Malenia, Blade of Miquella - This boss can be challenging, but she has a predictable pattern of movement and can be defeated relatively quickly if you understand her moveset.
4. Mohg, Lord of Blood - This boss has a large health pool, but he can be defeated relatively quickly if you use a combination of melee attacks and spells.
5. Radahn, the Golden Order - This boss has a lot of HP, but he can be defeated relatively quickly if you use a combination of melee attacks and spells.
6. Rykard, Lord of Blades - This boss has a high defense rating, but he can be defeated relatively quickly if you use a combination of melee attacks and spells.
7. Morgott, the Omen King - This boss has a lot of HP and a powerful sword, but he can be defeated relatively quickly if you use a combination of melee attacks and spells.
8. Elden Beast - This boss has a massive amount of HP, but he can be defeated relatively quickly if you use a combination of melee attacks and spells.

It's important to note that speedrunning requires a good understanding of the game mechanics, enemy patterns, and optimal strategies for defeating bosses. It also involves careful planning and execution, so it may take some practice to perfect the ideal route. Additionally, keep in mind that different players have different playstyles and preferences, so this suggested boss sequence may not be the best option for everyone. Ultimately, the most efficient boss sequence will depend on your individual skills, abilities, and personal playstyle. Good luck on your speedrun journey!</s>
